item.title: Chrome to Distrust Chunghwa Telecom and Netlock Certificates
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Patterns of concerning behavior led Google to remove trust in certificates from Chunghwa Telecom and Netlock from Chrome.

The post Chrome to Distrust Chunghwa Telecom and Netlock Certificates appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Alleged Conti, TrickBot Gang Leader Unmasked
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Russian national Vitaly Nikolaevich Kovalev is believed to be the leader of the Conti and TrickBot cybercrime groups.

The post Alleged Conti, TrickBot Gang Leader Unmasked appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Technical Details Published for Critical Cisco IOS XE Vulnerability
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The critical flaw, tracked as CVE-2025-20188 (CVSS score of 10/10), allows attackers to execute arbitrary code remotely.

The post Technical Details Published for Critical Cisco IOS XE Vulnerability appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Counter Antivirus Service AVCheck Shut Down by Law Enforcement
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Counter antivirus services such as AVCheck allow cybercriminals to test whether their malware is detected by antivirus products.

The post Counter Antivirus Service AVCheck Shut Down by Law Enforcement appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: US Government Is Investigating Messages Impersonating Trump’s Chief of Staff, Susie Wiles
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
Elected officials, business executives and other prominent figures in recent weeks received messages from someone impersonating Susie Wiles.

The post US Government Is Investigating Messages Impersonating Trump’s Chief of Staff, Susie Wiles appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: In Other News: PoC for Fortinet Bug, AI Model Subverts Shutdown, RAT Source Code Leaked
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
Noteworthy stories that might have slipped under the radar: simple PoC code released for Fortinet zero-day, OpenAI O3 disobeys shutdown orders, source code of SilverRAT emerges online.

The post In Other News: PoC for Fortinet Bug, AI Model Subverts Shutdown, RAT Source Code Leaked appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Firebase, Google Apps Script Abused in Fresh Phishing Campaigns
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Security researchers flag two phishing campaigns abusing Firebase and Google Apps Script to host malware and fake login pages.

The post Firebase, Google Apps Script Abused in Fresh Phishing Campaigns appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: US Sanctions Philippine Company for Supporting Crypto Scams
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The US Treasury Department US has slapped sanctions on Funnull Technology for providing support to cryptocurrency investment scams.

The post US Sanctions Philippine Company for Supporting Crypto Scams appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Watch Now: Why Context is a Secret Weapon in Application Security Posture Management
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
Join the live webinar to understand why data in itself is not enough to make informed decisions for prioritization.

The post Watch Now: Why Context is a Secret Weapon in Application Security Posture Management appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Chinese Hacking Group APT41 Exploits Google Calendar to Target Governments
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
China-linked hackers used a compromised government site to target other government entities with the ToughProgress malware that uses an attacker-controlled Google Calendar for C&C.

The post Chinese Hacking Group APT41 Exploits Google Calendar to Target Governments appeared first on SecurityWeek.
